column2: Indikator BHS
column3: Indicator English

column2: Ljudi se ne pitaju svakodnevno hoće li biti rata.
column3: People don't ask themselves every day if there will be a war.

column2: Nacionalnost ne utiče na to da li će neko biti prijatelj ili ne.
column3: Nationality does not affect whether someone will be friends or not.

column2: Nikome nije u interesu da u BiH opet bude rat.
column3: It's in no one's interest for there to be another war in B&H.

column2: U Potocima je pokrenut zajednički projekat edukativnih radionica koji okuplja žene sve tri nacije
column3: A joint project of educational workshops has been launched in Potoci, bringing together women from all three nations.

column2: U slastičarni u Potocima postoje i palačinke, kako bi se mladi mogli družiti jedući palačinke.
column3: There are also pancakes served in the patisserie in Potoci, so that young people can socialize while eating pancakes.

column2: I Srbi i Hrvati i Bošnjaci jednako vole svoje Potoke.
column3: Serbs, Croats and Bosniaks all love Potoci equally as their own.

column2: Ljudi u Potocima opet imaju izvorsku vodu u kanalima za navodnjavanje
column3: People in Potoci again have spring water in the irrigation canals

column2: Cigare se ne prodaju osobama mlađim od 18 godina.
column3: Cigarettes are not sold to persons under 18 years of age.

column2: Bijelo Polje je „šareno“ – jedna kuća muslimanska, druga katolička, treća pravoslavna
column3: Bijelo Polje is "colourful" – one Muslim house, another Catholic, the third Orthodox.

column2: Postoje projekti NVO-a u Potocima gdje se ljudi svih nacija druže.
column3: There are NGO projects in Potoci where people of all nations socialize.

column2: Susjedi u Potocima sarađuju jedni s drugima da se poboljša stanje, jer nije dovoljno da samo vlada mir.
column3: Neighbors in Potoci cooperate with each other to improve the situation, because it is not enough that peace reigns.

column2: Ljudi u Potocima sade poljoprivredne proizvode i na taj način žive od svoga rada.
column3: People in Potoci plant agricultural products and in that way make a living from their work.

column2: Radnice u kladionicama ne puštaju djecu da kockaju.
column3: Workers in betting shops do not let children gamble.

column2: Alkohol se ne prodaje osobama mlađim od 18 godina.
column3: Alcohol is not sold to people under 18 years of age.

column2: Kada su bili protesti na Uborku, niko nije pitao ko je ko.
column3: When there were protests at Uborak, no one asked who was who.

column2: Djeca se uče u školi da se ne razlikuju po vjeri.
column3: Children are taught in school not to differ each other by their religion.

column2: Autobusi za Mostar voze i kada nema škole.
column3: Buses to Mostar run even when there is no school.

column2: Mjesne zajednice ne dozvoljavaju da se kladionice otvaraju pored škola.
column3: Local communities do not allow betting shops to open next to schools.

column2: U Potocima bošnjačka, hrvatska i srpska djeca, idu zajedno u istu osnovnu školu.
column3: In Potoci, Bosniak, Croat and Serb children go to the same primary school together.

column2: Uvedeno je više autobuskih linija iz Potoka za Mostar.
column3: More bus lines from Potoci to Mostar have been introduced.

column2: Djeca u Potocima se igraju zajedno, bez obzira na nacionalnost
column3: Children in Potoci play together, regardless of their nationality.

column2: Uspostavljen je odbor mjesnih zajednica koji organizuje zajedničke aktivnosti (npr. kulturne, edukativne) za sve ljude.
column3: A local community committee has been established which organizes joint activities (e.g. cultural, educational) for all people.

column2: Na TV ne objavljuju svaku večer priče o ratu u BiH.
column3: They do not publish stories about the war in BiH on TV every night.

column2: Vozači u Potocima koriste žmigavce.
column3: Drivers in Potoci use turn signals.

column2: U Potocima mladi ljudi različitih nacionalnosti izlaze u iste kafiće.
column3: In Potoci, young people of different nationalities go out to the same cafes.

column2: Ljudi nisu prisiljeni navodnjavati bašte sa hlorisanom vodom iz slavine.
column3: People are not forced to irrigate their gardens with chlorinated tap water.

column2: Maloljetnici ne hodaju po klubovima poslije 22.00 sata.
column3: Minors don't frequent clubs after 10PM.

column2: Više ljudi ima posao.
column3: More people have jobs.

column2: U BiH je razvijen turizam zahvaljujući iskorištavanju postojećeg prirodnog bogatstva.
column3: Tourism has developed in B&H thanks to the use of existing natural resources.

column2: Otac se trudi da se mržnja prema drugim nacijama ne širi međi njegovom djecom.
column3: The father makes an effort not to spread hatred towards other nations among his children.

column2: Roditelji Red Army-a znaju šta im djeca rade.
column3: The parents of Red Army members know what their children are doing.

column2: Jednom mjesečno, organizuju se radionice za mlade u Potocima.
column3: Once a month, workshops for young people are organized in Potoci.

column2: Mostarski orkestar ne izvodi samo praznične koncerte, jer u Mostaru ima više prostora gdje mogu nastupiti za brojnu publiku.
column3: The Mostar Orchestra does not only perform holiday concerts, because there are more places in Mostar where they can perform for a large audience.

column2: Djevojka ima prijatelje i Bošnjake i Hrvate.
column3: The girl has both Bosniak and Croat friends.

column2: Mladi ljudi koji završe školu nisu prisiljeni odlaziti u inostranstvo (zbog posla).
column3: Young people who finish school are not forced to go abroad (for work).

column2: Ultrasi ne dolaze po noći u Potoke kako bi pisali slovo „U“ na fasadama u ulicama u kojoj su Hrvati manjina.
column3: Ultras do not come to Potoci at night to write the letter "U" on the facades in the streets where Croats are a minority.

column2: Studentice generacije ne moraju ići u Njemačku, zato jer mogu dobiti posao u Mostaru.
column3: Female valedictorians do not have to go to Germany, because they can get a job in Mostar.

column2: Mediji ne izvještavaju o tuči dvije starije žene blizu Mašinsko-saobraćajane škole kao o međunacionalnom incidentu nekih učenica te škole.
column3: The media do not report on the fight between two elderly women near the Mechanical and Traffic School as an interethnic incident of some students of that school.

column2: Ljude se ne ubija u pojam tako da im se svaki dan serviraju male doze negativnih vijesti.
column3: People's spirits are not crushed by being serving small doses of negative news every day.

column2: Djevojka se neće promijeniti za nekoga kome se ne sviđa kako se oblači.
column3: A girl will not change for someone who does not like the way she dresses.

column2: Djevojka koja živi na granici između Hrvata i Bošnjaka u Potocima, ne može osjetiti da su drugačiji.
column3: A girl living on the border between Croats and Bosniaks in Potoci cannot feel that they are different.

column2: Za razliku od starijih generacija koje su doživjele rat, mladi žive bez nacionalnih podjela jer nisu doživjeli rat.
column3: Unlike the older generations who experienced the war, the young live without national divisions because they have not experienced the war.

column2: Kad djevojka dođe iz škole umorna, majka joj daje bar sat vremena da se malo opusti i odmori.
column3: When a girl comes home from school tired, her mother gives her at least an hour to rest and relax.

column2: Kada su bili protesti na Uborku, svi su, bez obzira na vjeru i nacionalnost, izašli na ulice, kako bi branili svoje mjesto.
column3: When there were protests at Uborak, everyone, regardless of religion or nationality, took to the streets to protect their place.

column2: Kad se desi neki incident između ljudi različitih nacionalnosti u gradu, ljudi ne govore, “ono su njihovi, to su naši.”
column3: When there is an incident between people of different nationalities in the city, people don't say, "these are theirs, and these are ours."

column2: Kada se desi incident poput tuče huligana, za to se ne krivi jedna cijela nacija.
column3: When an incident like a hooligan fight happens, one whole nation is not blamed for that.

column2: Smrad s Uborka se ne širi do Potoka.
column3: The stench from Uborak does not spread to Potoci.

column2: Vlast nije korumpirana i zato ne nastaju sukobi na nacionalnoj osnovi.
column3: The government is not corrupt and therefore conflicts do not arise on a national basis.

column2: Roditelji svojoj djeci ne pune glavu nacionalističkim predrasudama.
column3: Parents do not fill their children's heads with nationalist prejudices.

column2: Roditelji ne moraju imati političke veze da bi se njihova djeca zaposlila u Mostaru.
column3: Parents do not have to have political connections in order for their children to be employed in Mostar.

column2: Ljudi u Potocima nisu uznemireni zato što svaku večer na TV čuju priču o ratu.
column3: People in Potoci are not disturbed because they hear the war propaganda on TV every night.

column2: Mediji ne prihvataju da za novac propagiraju rat.
column3: The media does not accept to propagate war for money.

column2: Grafiti budu samo kratko u Potocima, jer ih ljudi prefarbaju.
column3: Graffiti is in Potoci for a short time only, because people repaint it.

column2: U Potocima su ljudi bliži jedni drugima, jer su manja zajednica od Mostara.
column3: In Potoci, people are closer to each other because they are a smaller community than Mostar.

column2: Svako u Potocima ima s kim izaći vani i družiti se.
column3: Everyone in Potoci has someone to go out and socialize with.

column2: Kada su bili protesti na Uborku, svi su, bez obzira na vjeru i nacionalnost, izašli na ulice da protestuju za čist zrak.
column3: When there were protests in Uborak, everyone, regardless of religion and nationality, took to the streets to protest for clean air.

column2: Grad Mostar je napravio projekat, koji u Potocima potiče zajednički rad sve tri nacije.
column3: The city of Mostar has made a project, which encourages the joint work of all three nations in Potoci.

column2: Hrvat iz Potoka ne može biti agresor u Potocima.
column3: A Croat from Potoci cannot be an aggressor in Potoci.

column2: Ljudi ukazuju političarima na svoje potrebe po pitanju zapošljavanja.
column3: People point out their employment needs to politicians.

column2: Malonogometni turnir „Omer Tipura“, koji se organizuje svako ljeto u Potocima, okuplja veliki broj timova iz Mostara i okoline.
column3: The indoor football tournament "Omer Tipura", which is organized every summer in Potoci, gathers a large number of teams from Mostar and the surrounding area.

column2: Ljudi prihvataju škole podijeljene po nacionalnosti, jer prihvataju kulturološke razlike između ljudi.
column3: People accept schools divided by nationality because they accept cultural differences between people.

column2: Roditelji zajedno organizuju vannastavne projkete (edukativne radionice) za izgradnju pozitivnih ličnosti mladih.
column3: Parents together organize extracurricular projects (educational workshops) to build positive personalities/characters of young people.

column2: Kada Hrvatica i njena porodica imaju blagdane, bošnjačke porodice uvijek zovu da im čestitaju.
column3: When a Croat and her family have holidays, Bosniak families always call to wish them a happy holiday.

column2: Mladi razumiju da su starijim generacijama ostale neke ratne traume.
column3: Young people understand that the older generations are left with some war trauma.

column2: Ljudi znaju mirno rješavati probleme, da ne dođe do podjela u trenutku kada se u gradu desi neki incident između ljudi različitih nacionalnosti.
column3: People know how to solve problems peacefully, so that there is no division in the moment when there is an incident in the city between people of different nationalities.

column2: Ako je neki Ante nekome razbio glavu, ne znači da bi to uradio i Ivan.
column3: If some Ante broke someone's head, it doesn't mean that Ivan would do the same.

column2: Žena iz Potoka nije izgubila nadu da se išta može promijeniti u vezi raspisivanja konkursa.
column3: A woman from Potoci does not lose hope that something can change regarding the announcement of a [job] vacancy.

column2: Djeca i u Potocima, kao i u Mostaru, imaju prijatelje druge vjere.
column3: Children in Potoci, like as in Mostar, have friends of other faiths.

column2: Zimski grad u Mostaru je za sve ljude.
column3: Winterville in Mostar is for all people.

column2: Vjera ne utiče na to da li će neko biti prijatelj ili ne.
column3: Faith does not affect whether someone will be friends or not.

column2: Ljudi u Potocima su navikli da čuju ezan sa džamije i zvona sa katoličke i pravoslavne crkve.
column3: People in Potoci are used to hearing the call to prayer from the mosque and the bells from the Catholic and Orthodox churches.

column2: Grad Mostar je osigurao novu pumpu za navodnjavanje iz jezera.
column3: The city of Mostar has provided a new irrigation pump for irrigation from the lake.

column2: Policija je odgovorna za sprečavanje huliganizma u Mostaru.
column3: Police are responsible for preventing hooliganism in Mostar.

column2: U Mostaru više nema huliganizma, jer huligani dobijaju 10-15 godina zatvora kada nekoga napadnu.
column3: There is no more hooliganism in Mostar, because hooligans get 10-15 years in prison when they attack someone.

column2: U Mostaru se osjete pomaci, nakon što je izabran novi gradonačelnik.
column3: You can feel progress in Mostar after the new mayor was elected.

column2: Više mladih ljudi je zaposleno pa imaju više međunacionalnog kontakta.
column3: More young people are employed so they have more interethnic contact.

column2: Djeca se uče u školi da se ne razlikuju po imenima.
column3: Children are taught in school not to differentiate amongst one another by their name.

column2: U Mostaru postoje srednje škole koje nisu podijeljene po nacionalnosti.
column3: There are high schools in Mostar that are not divided by nationality.

column2: Djeca Hrvatice iz Potoka, koja su išla u Muzičku školu u Mostaru sa bošnjačkom djecom, su se nastavili družiti s njima i poslije škole.
column3: The children of a Croat from Potoci, who went to the Music School in Mostar with Bosniak children, continued to hang out with them after school.

column2: Nacionalne podjele se ne prenose sa starijih na mlade.
column3: National divisions are not passed on from the elderly to the young.

column2: Hrvatska djeca idu u školu u Potocima, jer u njoj ima i hrvatski program.
column3: Croatian children go to school in Potoci, because there is also a Croatian curriculum there.

column2: Žena Bošnjakinja iz Potoka odgaja svoju djecu da je najvažnije biti čovjek, pa tek onda Bošnjak.
column3: A Bosniak woman from Potoci teaches her children that the most important thing is to first be a human, and only then a Bosniak.

column2: Djeca u kritičnoj dobi imaju mogućnost da korisno provode svoje vrijeme, npr. kroz sport.
column3: Children at a critical age have the possibility to spend their time usefully, for example through sports.

column2: Bivši ratni zarobljenik iz Potoka na javnim tribinama širom BiH šalje poruke pomirenja.
column3: A former prisoner of war from Potoci is sending messages of reconciliation in public tribunes across B&H.

column2: Hrvati i Bošnjaci u Potocima ne žive podijeljeni po ulicama.
column3: Croats and Bosniaks in Potoci do not live divided by streets.

column2: Ni u Mostaru, ni u Potocima, ljudi se ne ističu kao da su oni neko i nešto.
column3: Neither in Mostar or in Potoci do people portray themselves as if they are someone and something [special].

column2: Mladi u Potocima se druže na košarkaškim terenima.
column3: Young people in Potoci hang out on basketball courts.

column2: Mladi u Potocima se druže na fudbalskim terenima.
column3: Young people in Potoci hang out on football fields.

column2: Mladić Bošnjak i dalje ima prijatelje pravoslavce s kojima je išao u Mašinsko-saobraćajnu školu.
column3: A young Bosniak guy still has Orthodox friends with whom he went to the Mechanical and Traffic School.

column2: Ljudi znaju mirno rješavati probleme, da ne dođe do podjela u trenutku kada se dignu nacionalne tenzije tokom utakmica 2 kluba u Mostaru.
column3: People know how to solve problems peacefully, so that there is no division at the moment when national tensions rise during the matches of the 2 (football) clubs in Mostar.

column2: Djeca Bošnjakinje iz Potoka se svakodnevno igraju sa komšijama Srbima
column3: Bosniak children from Potoci play with their Serb neighbors every day.

column2: U kafić "Pub" u Potocima dolaze ljudi svih nacionalnosti.
column3: People of all nationalities come to the cafe "Pub" in Potoci.

column2: Roditelji Bošnjakinje iz Potoka su povratnici u Višiće (općina Čapljina) i sasvim normalno se druže sa komšijama Hrvatima.
column3: The parents of a Bosniak woman from Potoci are returnees to Višići (Čapljina municipality) and they hang out with their Croat neighbors in a completely normal manner.

column2: Ljudi u Mostaru nisu zaostali i ne spominju svaki dan šta je bilo prije 35 godina.
column3: People in Mostar are not stuck in the past and do not mention every day what happened 35 years ago [prewar].

column2: Ljudi u Mostaru nisu zaostali i ne spominju svaki dan rat.
column3: People in Mostar are not stuck in the past, mentioning the war every day.

column2: Hrvat u Potocima ne primjećuje probleme na nacionalnoj osnovi.
column3: A Croat in Potoci does not notice any problems on a national basis.

column2: U Potocima vlada tolerancija po pitanju miješanih brakova.
column3: In Potoci, tolerance reigns in regards to mixed marriages.

column2: Hrvatu iz Potoka priskoči u pomoć susjed Salko kad god je potrebno.
column3: A Croat from Potoci comes to the aid of his neighbor Salko whenever necessary.

column2: U Potocima nema međunacionalnih tuča na dnevnoj osnovi.
column3: There are no interethnic fights in Potoci on a daily basis.

column2: Ljudi u Potocima čuju obje strane (i bošnjačku i hrvatsku) priče o ratu.
column3: People in Potoci hear both sides (Bosniak and Croat) of war stories.

column2: Ljudi Srbi, Bošnjaci i Hrvati se lako slože oko asfaltiranja puta.
column3: Serbs, Bosniaks and Croats easily agree on paving the road.

column2: Nikome u Potocima ne smeta što su katoličke kuće prve do džamije
column3: Nobody in Potoci cares that Catholic houses are the first ones next to the mosque.

column2: Na deponiju Uborak ne dovozi se otpad iz cijele županije, pa i šire.
column3: Waste from the entire canton and beyond is not brought to the Uborak landfill.

column2: Nakon što su demonstranti deset dana blokirali ulaz u Uborak, odgovorni političari u Mostaru su ispunili obećanje da će riješiti problem otpada na Uborku.
column3: After the protesters blocked the entrance to Uborak for ten days, the politicians responsible for it in Mostar fulfilled their promise to solve the problem of waste in Uborak.

column2: Grad Mostar je osigurao obezbjeđenje pumpe za navodnjavanje iz jezera (pumpa nije ukradena kao prethodna dva puta).
column3: The city of Mostar has provided a pump for irrigation from the lake (the pump has not been stolen like the previous two times).

column2: Postavljeni su ležeći policajci na glavnoj ulici u Potocima.
column3: Speed bumps were placed on the main street in Potoci.

column2: Političari na vlasti u BiH ne iniciraju* nacionalne tenzije putem medija.
column3: Politicians in power in BiH do not initiate national tensions through the media.

column2: Vladajući političari ne dižu nacionalne tenzije da bi oni ostali na vlasti 30 godina.
column3: Ruling politicians do not raise national tensions in ordeer to keep themselves in power for 30 years.

column2: Uvedeni su radari za kontrolu brzine na magistrali u Potocima.
column3: Speed ​​control radars have been introduced on the Potoci highway.

column2: Stanovnik Potoka traži od mjesne zajednice da se postavi ležeći policajac kod škole.
column3: A resident of Potoci is requesting from the local MZ to place a speed bump near the school.

column2: Kada ljudi u Potocima unajmljuju radnike, niko ne govori „zašto si uzeo njega“ (misleći na nacionalnost radnika).
column3: When people in Potoci hire workers, no one says "why did you hire him?" (referring to the nationality of the worker).

column2: Huligani ne napadaju one koji ne navijaju za njihov tim.
column3: Hooligans do not assault those who do not cheer for their team.

column2: Ljudi razlikuju navijače od huligana.
column3: People distinguish (football) fans from hooligans.

column2: Huligani se ne organizuju da bi se tukli nakon utakmice Veleža i Zrinjskog u Mostaru.
column3: Hooligans do not organize fights after the match between Velež and Zrinjski (football teams) in Mostar.

column2: Nema nikakvih problema među sportistima u Mostaru.
column3: There are no problems among athletes in Mostar.

column2: Djeca Hrvatice iz Potoka idu u teretanu gdje su većinom Bošnjaci i nikada im niko nije ništa ružno rekao.
column3: The children of a Croat woman from Potoci go to the gym where there are mostly Bosniaks and no one has ever said anything bad to them.

column2: Roditelji Ultrasa znaju šta im djeca rade.
column3: Parents of Ultras members know what their children are doing.

column2: Djeca iz 3., 4. i 5. razreda osnovne škole ne pjevaju ratne pjesme.
column3: Children from 3rd, 4th and 5th grade of primary school do not sing war songs.

column2: Djeca u školama idu zajedno na 80% predmeta, a ostalo imaju prema nacionalnom izboru (jezik itd.).
column3: Children in schools attend 80% courses together, and the rest is according to their national choice (language, etc.).

column2: Političarima u BiH odgovara da škole u Mostaru nisu podijeljene po nacionalnosti.
column3: It suits politicians in B&H that schools in Mostar are not nationally divided.

column2: Razred u kojem ima Bošnjaka i Srba sasvim normalno* funkcioniše.
column3: The class in which there are Bosniaks and Serbs functions quite normally.

column2: Ljudi nisu prisiljeni svaki dan slušati o ratu, jer se onda pitaju ima li smisla započinjati bilo kakav posao.
column3: People are not forced to hear about war every day, because then they ask themselves if it makes sense to start any kind of job.

column2: Mediji ne objavljuju vijesti koje potiču mržnju na nacionalnoj osnovi.
column3: The media does not publish news that incites hatred on a national basis.

column2: Postoji koncertna dvorana sa preko 900 mjesta u Potocima, tako da se ljudi iz Mostara i okolnih mjesta mogu lako okupiti.
column3: There is a concert hall with over 900 seats in Potoci, so that people from Mostar and surrounding places can easily gather.

column2: Ljeti dolaze grupe folklora iz Crne Gore koje igraju svoje narodno kolo na terenu u Potocima.
column3: In the summer, folklore groups from Montenegro come and perform their national folk dance on the field in Potoci.

column2: U Potocima ljudi poštuju saobraćajne propise.
column3: In Potoci, people respect traffic regulations.

column2: Bošnjak mladić koji želi otići i gledati utakmicu Zrinjskog ne boji se da li će biti napadnut ili ne.
column3: A young Bosniak who wants to go and watch Zrinjski play is not worried if he is going to be attacked or not.

column2: Huligani Zrinjskog nisu slomili vilicu dječaku Bošnjaku iz Potoka na utakmici Zrinjski-Željezničar.
column3: Zrinjski's hooligans did not fracture the jaw of a Bosniak boy from Potoci during the Zrinjski-Željezničar match.

column2: Bivši ratni zarobljenik iz Potoka je mirovni aktivista već 12 godina.
column3: The former prisoner of war from Potoci has been a peace activist for 12 years.

column2: Djeca iz Potoka ne počinju kockati s 10 godina.
column3: Children from Potoci do not start gambling when they are 10 years old.
